item.title: systemd sends SIGKILL signals after waiting for `TimeoutStopSec` seconds
item.description: From man systemd.kill: Processes will first be terminated via SIGTERM (unless the signal to send is changed via KillSignal=).

item.title: systemd timers can be stopped
item.description: Timers are systemd unit files that control services. I didn’t realise until today that, when disabling a timer, it also needs to be stopped too.
